name: Hydrogen
description: Hydrogen is the most abundant element in the universe and serves as the building block for stars and galaxies. It's essential for life as we know it and is a key component in water.

name: Oxygen
description: Oxygen is the breath of life, quite literally! It makes up about 21% of Earth's atmosphere and is essential for cellular respiration in most forms of life.

name: Carbon
description: Carbon is the backbone of all organic life, forming the basis for organic chemistry. It's versatile, able to form multiple types of bonds, and is a key component in fossil fuels.

name: Nitrogen
description: Nitrogen is a colorless, odorless gas that makes up about 78% of Earth's atmosphere. It's crucial for life, forming an essential component of amino acids and DNA.

name: Sodium
description: Sodium is a soft, silvery-white metal that's highly reactive. It's essential for animal life in small amounts but can be harmful in excess.

name: Chlorine
description: Chlorine is a yellow-green gas at room temperature and is highly reactive. It's used in a variety of applications, from disinfecting water to producing everyday products like paper and plastics.

name: Phosphorus
description: Phosphorus is a non-metal that is essential for life. It's a key component of DNA, RNA, and ATP, the energy currency of cells.

name: Calcium
description: Calcium is a soft, gray metal that's best known for its role in supporting strong bones and teeth in animals.

name: Silicon
description: Silicon is the second most abundant element in Earth's crust and is the foundation of the modern tech industry, used in everything from computer chips to solar panels.

name: Iron
description: Iron is a metal that has been used by humans for thousands of years. It's essential for transporting oxygen in the blood and is used in a variety of industrial applications.
